sentence1: Starkad, the hero of the legends, the bravest warrior in the army of the North, had fallen into disgrace with the king because of a certain princess, so he wandered up into Norland, and settled down at Rude in Tuna, where he was known as the Thrall of the Alders or the Red Fellow.
sentence2: One morning Starkad climbed the Klefberg in Tuna, and called over to Bale: "Bale in Balbo, are you awake?"

sentence1: One morning Starkad climbed the Klefberg in Tuna, and called over to Bale: "Bale in Balbo, are you awake?"
sentence2: answered Bale, nine miles away, "the sun and I wake together!

sentence1: answered Bale, nine miles away, "the sun and I wake together!
sentence2: I eat salmon morning, noon and night.

sentence1: I eat salmon morning, noon and night.

sentence2: Bale called back, and in a few hours time he was down in Tuna with an elk under each arm.

sentence1: Bale called back, and in a few hours time he was down in Tuna with an elk under each arm.
sentence2: The following morning Bale in Balbo stood on a hill in Borgsjo and called: "Red Fellow!

sentence1: The following morning Bale in Balbo stood on a hill in Borgsjo and called: "Red Fellow!

sentence2: "Alas, I have nothing to eat but meat!

sentence1: "Alas, I have nothing to eat but meat!
sentence2: Come over and bring a fish-tail along with you!"

sentence1: Come over and bring a fish-tail along with you!"

sentence2: called out Starkad, and in a short time he had joined his friend with a barrel of salmon under each arm.

sentence1: called out Starkad, and in a short time he had joined his friend with a barrel of salmon under each arm.
sentence2: In this fashion the two friends provided themselves with all the game to be found in the woods and in the water, and spread terror and destruction throughout the countryside.

sentence1: In this fashion the two friends provided themselves with all the game to be found in the woods and in the water, and spread terror and destruction throughout the countryside.
sentence2: But one evening, when they were just returning to the sea from an excursion, a black cloud came up, and a tempest broke.

sentence1: But one evening, when they were just returning to the sea from an excursion, a black cloud came up, and a tempest broke.
sentence2: They hurried along as fast as they could;

sentence1: They hurried along as fast as they could;
sentence2: but got no further than Vattjom, where a flash of lightning struck Starkad and flung him to the ground.

sentence2: His friend and companion-at-arms buried him beneath a stone cairn, about which he set five rocks: two at his feet, two at his shoulders, and one at his head;
